content: I was talking with @pnkfelix about the labels on our issues that are related to libs implementation things
now that T-compiler is taking over that work, I wonder if we should review all the T-libs issues and see if they are related to impl details and tag them with libs-impl
or should we let that happen as we go
mainly to see what kind of searches we should do during @WG-prioritization meetings
sharing the discussion here so we can read thoughts from others too
eventually, I think that it would make sense to change to "implementation team", and T-implementation
however, I think it's probably good to "try things out" for a bit before committing to that
which I guess isn't really what you asked :)
I guess I think that kind of triage likely does make sense, but I'm not sure how much sense it makes to do it actively
@nikomatsakis so I guess a good commitment is to add searches for libs-impl to our prioritization procedures and leave the tagging up for contributors

Santiago Pastorino said:

or should we let that happen as we go

that's what I meant here, leave the tagging fixing up to contributors in general
